SEARCH
Package com.nickslibrary.datastructures.linear

Class LinkedList<T>

java.lang.Object
com.nickslibrary.datastructures.linear.LinkedList<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of elements in the list.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<T>
public class LinkedList<T> extends Object implements Iterable<T>
A generic LinkedList class that supports both singly and doubly linked lists with optional circular behavior.

  • Constructor Details

    • LinkedList

      public LinkedList(boolean isCircular, boolean isSinglyLinked)
      Constructs a new LinkedList with the specified properties.
      Parameters:
      isCircular - If true, the list will be circular.
      isSinglyLinked - If true, the list will be singly linked.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(T data)
      Adds a new node with the specified data to the list.
      Parameters:
      data - The data to store in the new node.

    • insert

      public void insert(int index, T data)
      Inserts a new node at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index where the new node should be inserted.
      data - The data to store in the new node.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is out of bounds.

    • remove

      public void remove(T data)
      Removes the first occurrence of the specified value from the list. If the value is not found, the list remains unchanged.
      Parameters:
      data - The data to be removed from the list.

    • removeAt

      public void removeAt(int index)
      Removes the node at the specified index in the list. If the index is out of bounds, an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the node to be removed.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid (less than 0 or greater than or equal to the size of the list).

    • search

      public int search(T data)
      Searches for the specified data in the list and returns the index of the first occurrence. If the data is not found, it returns -1. The search is performed by iterating through the list until a match is found. If the list is circular, the search stops once the loop reaches the head again.
      Parameters:
      data - The data to search for in the list.
      Returns:
      The index of the first occurrence of the data, or -1 if not found.

    • get

      public T get(int index)
      Returns the data at the specified index in the list. If the index is out of bounds, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown. In the case of a circular list, the index is adjusted to wrap around. If the list is empty, an IllegalStateException is thrown. If the index is closer to the head, the list is traversed starting from the head, otherwise, traversal begins from the tail. The traversal method depends on whether the list is singly or doubly linked.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the element to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The data at the specified index.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is out of bounds.
      IllegalStateException - If the list is empty.

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of nodes in the list.
      Returns:
      The size of the list, indicating the number of elements it contains.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the list is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the list contains no elements, false otherwise.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all elements from the list, effectively clearing the list. After calling this method, the list will be empty.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(T data)
      Checks if the specified value exists in the list.
      Parameters:
      data - the value to search for in the list
      Returns:
      true if the value is found, false otherwise

    • toArray

      public T[] toArray()
      Converts the list to an array of the same type.
      Returns:
      an array containing all the elements of the list
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the type of the list's elements is incompatible with the array

    • printList

      public void printList()
      Prints the elements of the list to the console. If the list is empty, a message indicating so is printed. For circular lists, the method ensures that the list is not printed indefinitely.

    • reverse

      public void reverse()
      Reverses the list, adjusting the next and prev pointers. This method is particularly useful for doubly linked lists, as it modifies both the next and prev pointers of each node. If the list is empty or has only one element, no reversal occurs. In circular lists, the tail will correctly point to the head after reversal.

    • iterator

      public Iterator<T> iterator()
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<T>
